com.viaoa.remote.multiplexer

Class OARemoteThread

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.lang.Thread
      • com.viaoa.remote.multiplexer.OARemoteThread
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Runnable

    public class OARemoteThread
extends Thread
    Thread that is used to process all remote method calls.
    Author:
    vvia

    • Method Detail

      • setAllowRunnable

        public void setAllowRunnable(boolean b)
        Flag to know if the addRunnable was overwritten to handle in another thread (pool). Otherwise, calling addRunnable will call the run() method directly.

      • getAllowRunnable

        public boolean getAllowRunnable()

      • addRunnable

        public void addRunnable(Runnable r)
        By default, this will call r.run(). This can be overwritten to have it ran in another way.

      • startNextThread

        public void startNextThread()

      • startedNextThread

        public boolean startedNextThread()

      • setSendMessages

        public void setSendMessages(boolean b)
        Any OAsync changes (OAObject/Hub) that are made within an OARemoteThread will not be broadcast to other computers, since they will also be processing the same originating message. This can be set to true, so that any OASync changes will be sent out. This is useful when an event listener will only run on the server, and any sync changes will then be sent to others. False by default.

      • getSendMessages

        public boolean getSendMessages()

      • setWaitingOnLock

        public void setWaitingOnLock(boolean b)
        Flag to know if this thread is waiting on a lock set by OATreadLocalDelegate.
        Parameters:
        b -

      • isWaitingOnLock

        public boolean isWaitingOnLock()

        public void setStartedNextThread(boolean b)

        public void reset()
        called before processing the next OASync message.
